items.title: The honest feedback Alcaraz gave shattered de Minaur after Aus Open exit
items.description: Alex de Minaur acknowledges he needs improvement in his game, as Carlos Alcaraz moves on to the Australian Open semifinals.

items.title: Andrew and Tristan Tate lose bid to sue Adelaide YouTuber, launch appeal
items.description: An Australian YouTuber who is being sued by Andrew and Tristan Tate in a Florida court has won a bid to have the case dismissed, a decision the self-described misogynist influencers are now appealing.

items.title: ICE deported a man awaiting trial over 'largest jewellery heist in history'
items.description: An Ecuadorian man accused of aiding the theft of about $147 million worth of gold, gems and luxury watches was deported by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency before he could face trial.

items.title: Australia's largest city is running out of landfill. It's causing a trash war
items.description: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year, and it has locals divided about the long-term health risks and environmental impacts.

items.title: Historic heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
items.description: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

items.title: Government turns defence sights north with $355m RAAF base upgrade
items.description: A Royal Australian Air Force base near Katherine in the NT is updated with purpose-built hangars and improved runways.

items.title: Rally organiser's claim of 'bashing' by Middle Eastern men comes unstuck
items.description: March for Australia claims one of its organisers was bashed by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day, but police and an eyewitness account have cast doubt on its claim.

items.title: Health minister promises change after woman overdoses from stockpiled meds
items.description: The tragic death of a young Melbourne woman who was stockpiling medication has prompted the federal health minister to move to change the way prescriptions are recorded.

items.title: Lunai Bioworks launches AI tool to block chemical weapon design

featured_image.name: Without safeguards, AI-Biology integration risks accelerating future ...

items.description:
Lunai Bioworks on Tuesday announced the deployment of Sentinel, a transformer-based AI safeguard designed to prevent large language models and scientific AI systems from generating novel chemical agents. The Sacramento-based biotech company said the technology embeds directly within foundation models to screen molecular outputs in real time, functioning as what CEO David Weinstein described as "the immune system for scientific AI."[1][2]

"As AI models become more powerful, safety has to move closer to the core," Weinstein said in a statement. "Sentinel operates inside AI systems—not outside them—stopping dangerous chemical designs before they are ever produced."[3][1]

The launch comes amid mounting concern over the dual-use risks of advanced AI in chemistry and biology, with major AI companies including Anthropic and OpenAI warning that powerful models could assist bad actors in developing biological and chemical threats.

items.title: OpenAI launches dedicated team to accelerate AI use in science

featured_image.name: Altman touts trillion-dollar AI vision as OpenAI ...

items.description:
OpenAI has unveiled a dedicated team to transform the use of artificial intelligence in scientific research, positioning its GPT-5 model as a collaborative partner for mathematicians and scientists while urging policymakers to expand support for AI-driven discovery.

The initiative, called OpenAI for Science, was first announced in October 2025 and is led by Kevin Weil, a company vice president with a background in particle physics who nearly completed a PhD at Stanford before entering the tech industry.[1][2]

items.title: Chinese firm unveils plan to send humanoid robot to space

featured_image.name: Chinese firm launches effort to send humanoid robot into ...

items.description: A Chinese humanoid robot has been directly connected to a low-Earth orbit satellite for the first time in the world, while a separate initiative aims to send a humanoid into space as a robot astronaut—two advances that underscore China's accelerating push into the burgeoning field of embodied artificial intelligence.

items.title: Carney rejects US claim he walked back criticism of Trump trade policy

featured_image.name: Carney walked back Davos comments in call with Trump, US treasury chief says

items.description:
Prime Minister Mark Carney told President Donald Trump that Canada stands by its trade diversification strategy and recent deal with China during a phone call Monday, pushing back against claims from the Trump administration that he had backed down from his earlier criticism of American trade policy.

"I meant what I said in Davos," Carney told reporters Tuesday before a cabinet meeting in Ottawa. "Canada was the first country to understand the change in U.S. trade policy that he had initiated, and we're responding to that."[1][2]

The call comes amid escalating tensions between Washington and Ottawa as the two countries prepare for a formal review of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement later this year. Trump had threatened over the weekend to impose 100% tariffs on Canadian goods if Canada proceeds with a trade agreement with China, posting on Truth Social that Prime Minister Carney was "gravely mistaken" if he thought Canada could become a "Drop Off Port" for Chinese products.[3][4]

items.title: Doomsday Clock moves to 85 seconds before midnight

featured_image.name: Doomsday Clock 2026 announcement says Earth is 85 seconds to ...

items.description:
The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists advanced the Doomsday Clock to 85 seconds before midnight on Tuesday, marking the closest the symbolic timepiece has ever been to catastrophe. The four-second move from 89 seconds, set in January 2025, reflects what scientists say are intensifying nuclear threats, accelerating climate change, and the growing risks posed by artificial intelligence.

"The Doomsday Clock's message cannot be clearer," Alexandra Bell, president and CEO of the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, said at the announcement. "Catastrophic destruction, primarily due to nuclear risks and other global threats," is becoming increasingly probable, according to the organization.[1][2]

items.title: China opens world's largest compressed-air energy storage plant

featured_image.name: World's largest compressed air energy storage goes online in ...

items.description:
China has commenced operations on the world's largest compressed-air energy storage facility in Jiangsu province, marking a technical milestone in the nation's effort to stabilize its rapidly expanding renewable energy grid.

The Guoxin Suyan Huai'an Salt Cavern Compressed Air Energy Storage Demonstration Project consists of two 300-megawatt non-combustion units with a total storage capacity of 2,400 megawatt-hours, according to Harbin Electric Corporation, which announced the completion on January 27.[1][2][3]

items.title: Hybrids overtake petrol as EU's top-selling powertrain for first time

featured_image.name: Electric vehicle sales overtake petrol in EU for first time

items.description:
Europe's auto market crossed a historic threshold in 2025 as hybrid-electric vehicles became the most popular powertrain choice among car buyers, surpassing petrol for the first time, while fully electric vehicles also outsold petrol cars in December, according to data released by the European Automobile Manufacturers' Association (ACEA) on Tuesday.

Hybrid-electric vehicles captured 34.5% of the EU market in 2025, overtaking petrol cars at 26.6%, marking a fundamental shift in European consumer preferences. Battery-electric vehicles claimed an additional 17.4% market share, while plug-in hybrids added 9.4%—meaning electrified vehicles of all types collectively accounted for over 61% of new car sales in the bloc.[1][2]

items.title: NASA and GE Aerospace complete first hybrid electric jet engine test

featured_image.name: NASA, GE Aerospace Hybrid Engine System Marks Successful ...

items.description:
NASA and GE Aerospace have completed the first ground test of an integrated hybrid electric jet engine designed to power commercial airliners, marking a major step toward more fuel-efficient aviation.

The demonstration, conducted in December at GE Aerospace's Peebles Test Operation facility in Ohio, tested a modified Passport turbofan engine fitted with electric motor-generators capable of transferring, extracting, and injecting power during flight operations. The companies announced the successful milestone on January 26.[1][2][3]

items.title: Milano Cortina 2026 Olympics races to make snow as winters warm

featured_image.name: Italian snowmaking expert explains his role at Winter Olympics

items.description:
Snowmaking crews at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics are racing against time to prepare competition surfaces as climate change continues to shrink the windows of freezing temperatures needed to produce artificial snow.

With the opening ceremony scheduled for February 6 in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, organizers have relied heavily on snowmaking infrastructure to supplement increasingly unpredictable natural snowfall in Italy's Alpine venues. Recent snowfall over the past weekend has provided relief, but the long-term trend is clear: winters are warming, and the margin for error is narrowing.

items.title: World marks 80 years since Auschwitz liberation

featured_image.name: Auschwitz-Birkenau On The 81st Anniversary Of Liberation

items.description:
Candles flickered at dawn Tuesday at the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe in Berlin as people across the globe paused to observe International Holocaust Remembrance Day, reflecting on Nazi Germany's murder of millions and its attempt to annihilate Jewish life in Europe.

The annual commemoration falls on January 27, the anniversary of the 1945 liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau by Soviet forces. This year marks the 81st anniversary of that liberation, with the United Nations theme "Holocaust Remembrance for Dignity and Human Rights" guiding observances worldwide.[1][2][3]

items.title: As Trump watches on, India and EU lock in 'mother of all deals'
items.description: The agreement could impact nearly 2 billion people in both economies and comes amid an upheval in global trade stemming from Donald Trump's tariff policies.

items.title: Firefighters have worked through the night as Otway fire 'runs hard and fast'
items.description: Firefighters have been working into the night to contain a major fire in Victoria's Otway Ranges "running hard and fast" following a wind change on Tuesday.

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
